instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in not booting. SSD was the cause. Changed the SSD and it boots.

However, now the fan runs on full speed. HWSensors shows Airport Proximity Thermal Sensor at 129°C, all others just fine (around 40°C)
I don't have ASD for that machine, MRI Tool hangs and AHT shows no errors.

Already changed Airport Card, RIO Board, RIO Flex, no luck.

LD indicators are missing, but board doesn't show any signs of LD. If it was cleaned, it was cleaned properly. No corroded parts or any other hint.

Does anybody know some usual suspects for this?

BR!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: Hm, just checked on another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and found Airport Proximity always shows 129°C. So this shouldn't be the problem. But still, fan is running high. SMC Reset and PRAM Reset already done btw.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: Checked HWMonitor again. PECI SA shows fluctuating readings between 0 and 40 °C. Any idea which sensor that is?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: What error does built in diagnostic give? Hold down D and turn it on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: AHT gives no error. Will check <RESISTOR>R5134</RESISTOR> on monday

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: If there are no errors then there is no need to check <RESISTOR>R5134</RESISTOR>. Did you really run diagnostic? It must at least give a fan error.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message:
No Title

No errors. Only error is that MagSafe was not connected.

I found a little corrosion around <CHIP>U7320</CHIP> and replaced all bad looking parts around it. Also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> as it was not looking too good.

Still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: Figured PECI SA must be a sensor on the SSD, as the fans don't run high when the SSD is removed and also another device shows the same symptoms when this SSD is installed. Will replace the SSD and update the thread.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: Is the SSD from a 2015 model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan on full speed, Airport Proximity 129°C
threads.message: No actually it is from a 2014 model.
